relation: BAD_EXTENSIONS Indicates a certificate has unrecognized critical extensions.
BROKEN_CHAIN Indicates a certificate in a chain was not issued by the next authority in the chain.
CERTIFICATE_CHAIN_TOO_LONG Indicates the server certificate chain exceeds the length allowed by an issuer's policy.
EXPIRED Indicates a certificate is expired.
INAPPROPRIATE_KEY_USAGE Indicates a certificate public key has been used in way deemed inappropriate by the issuer.
MISSING_SIGNATURE Indicates a certificate object does not contain a signature.
NOT_YET_VALID Indicates a certificate is not yet valid.
ROOT_CA_EXPIRED Indicates the root CA's public key is expired.
SITENAME_MISMATCH Indicates a certificate does not contain the correct site name.
UNAUTHORIZED_INTERMEDIATE_CA Indicates an intermediate certificate in the chain does not have the authority to be a intermediate CA.
UNRECOGNIZED_ISSUER Indicates a certificate was issued by an unrecognized entity.
UNSUPPORTED_PUBLIC_KEY_TYPE Indicates that type of the public key in a certificate is not supported by the device.
UNSUPPORTED_SIGALG Indicates a certificate was signed using an unsupported algorithm.
VERIFICATION_FAILED Indicates a certificate failed verification.
